text: Victor Charles Buono (February 3, 1938January 1, 1982) was an American actor, comedian and recording artist. He was known for playing the villain King Tut in the television series Batman (1966â€“1968) and musician Edwin Flagg in What Ever Happened to Baby Jane? (1962), for which he was nominated for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actor. He was secretly gay. Buono died on January 1, 1982 in Apple Valley, California of a heart attack, aged 43. ==References== Category:1938 births Category:1982 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:Actors from San Diego Category:Comedians from San Diego Category:LGBT people from California Category:LGBT comedians Category:LGBT actors Category:Gay men
title: Victor Buono
